SEARCH
Package com.group7.krisefikser.repository

Class UserRepository

java.lang.Object
com.group7.krisefikser.repository.UserRepository
@Repository public class UserRepository extends Object
Repository class for managing user data in the database. This class provides methods to find users by email, save new users, and find users by ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserRepository

      @Autowired public UserRepository(org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate jdbcTemplate)
      Constructor for UserRepository. This constructor initializes the JdbcTemplate used for database operations.
      Parameters:
      jdbcTemplate - the JdbcTemplate to be used for database operations

  • Method Details

    • findByEmail

      public Optional<User> findByEmail(String email)
      Finds a user by their email address. This method queries the database for a user with the specified email. If a user is found, it returns an Optional containing the user. If no user is found, it returns an empty Optional.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user to be found
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, or an empty Optional if not found

    • findById

      public Optional<User> findById(Long id)
      Finds a user by their ID. This method queries the database for a user with the specified ID. If a user is found, it returns an Optional containing the user. If no user is found, it returns an empty Optional.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to be found
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, or an empty Optional if not found

    • save

      public Optional<User> save(User user)
      Saves a new user to the database. This method inserts a new user into the users table. If the user does not have a role, it sets the role to ROLE_NORMAL by default. If the user is saved successfully, it returns an Optional containing the saved user. If an error occurs during the save operation, it returns an empty Optional.
      Parameters:
      user - the user to be saved
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the saved user if successful, or an empty Optional if not

    • setVerified

      public Optional<User> setVerified(User user)
      Changes a user's verified status in the database. This method updates the verified status of a user based on their email address. If the update is successful, it returns an Optional containing the updated user.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose verified status is to be changed
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the updated user if successful, or an empty Optional if not

    • existAdminByUsername

      public boolean existAdminByUsername(String username)
      Checks the existence of an admin by their username. This method queries the database for an admin with the specified username. If an admin is found, it returns a true. If no admin is found, it returns false.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the admin to be found
      Returns:
      a bool if found

    • updateUserHousehold

      public void updateUserHousehold(Long userId, Long householdId)
      Updates a user's household association in the database. This method sets the household_id for a user with the specified user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose household is being updated
      householdId - the ID of the household to associate with the user

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(Long id)
      Deletes a user from the database by their ID. This method removes the user from the users table and also deletes any associated records from the join_household_requests table.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to be deleted

    • findByRole

      public List<User> findByRole(Role role)
      Finds users by their role. This method queries the database for users with the specified role. If users are found, it returns a list of users. If no users are found, it returns an empty list.
      Parameters:
      role - the role of the users to be found
      Returns:
      a list of users with the specified role, or an empty list if none are found

    • updatePasswordByEmail

      public void updatePasswordByEmail(String email, String hashedPassword)
      Updates a user's password in the database. This method sets the password for a user with the specified email. It is used for updating the password when a user requests a password reset.
      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user whose password is being updated
      hashedPassword - the new hashed password to be set
